results.title: The City as man's home
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
Slums, giant public housing complexes, mass suburbs, anonymous and bleak luxury apartments - almost everywhere in cities communal standards of living are falling even as personal standards of living rise. How did this happen and what can our cities do to improve communal living standards? These problems are discussed and fully illustrated.

results.title: The History of the Luftwaffe
results.brief_description: After the skirmishes of WW1 armed forces fought each other in the skies for the first time, and soon planes would presage every role of future armies and navies. Upon losing the war, the size of the German armed forces was restricted, to ensure that Germany did not become a military threat in Europe. In the 1920s the desire for new technology and military designs was urgent, and following Hitler’s rise to power in the 1930s, much of the research and development was conducted clandestinely. Despite restrictions, a massive and formidable air force - The Luftwaffe - was born, and Germany’s armed forces burgeoned. This documentary uses extensive archival footage, much of it recently recovered from the East and viewed for the first time, to display these weapons of war. The role of Hitler and Hermann Goering is discussed at length, as these two warmongers contributed to the fortunes of the Luftawaffe throughout WW2. Features extensive and fascinating black and white footage of Europe from the 1910s, 20s, 30s and 40s, showing the incredible devastation of war on the land and people. Aeroplane enthusiasts, and particularly those interested in war planes, should enjoy the historical visuals and informative narrative of the various planes of the Luftwaffe.

results.title: The History of soccer
results.creator_credit: Jamie Baker, Stewart Binns and WPE
results.brief_description: The definitive, all-encompassing documentary on the international history of the most popular sport in the world. This film goes back to the roots of football and traces its remarkable growth across the world. The story of the people’s game begins 2,000 years ago. All the major civilisations around the world have a record of soccer as part of their culture, with the oldest and most complete records found in China. This video features 3 hours of history and fantastic World Cup action.

results.title: The Heart of the city
results.creator_credit: Bryan Probyn, Claus Loof, Derek Knight, Erik Nielsen, Francois Seguillon, Hector Lemieux, Jacques Giraldeau, Jean-Claude Chiabaut, Kirk Jones, Leonard Forest, Mogens Gander, Reginald Morris, Terence Macartney-Filgate, Wim Smits, Ytzen Brusse, Guy Glover, Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
A study of the growing sterility, dullness and congestion that is destroying the vitality, variety and breadth that once made cities physically attractive and humanly creative. Narration: Budd Knapp.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bryan Probyn, Claus Loof, Derek Knight, Erik Nielsen, Francois Seguillon, Hector Lemieux, Jacques Giraldeau, Jean-Claude Chiabaut, Kirk Jones, Leonard Forest, Mogens Gander, Reginald Morris, Terence Macartney-Filgate, Wim Smits, Ytzen Brusse, Guy Glover, Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The history of Australian tennis
results.brief_description: Shows footage of players and matches, origins of the game, Davis and Federation Cups of the pre and post war era in Australian tennis.

results.title: The Holy Innocents = Los Santos Inocentes
results.creator_credit: Mario Camus, Julian Mateoas and Ganesh
results.brief_description: The Holy innocents is a poignant rural drama zeroing in on the abysmal class differences still existing in some sections of modern Spain, especially in the holdings of the rural aristocracy. The story concerns an impoverished family working on the estate of an aristocratic family in the province of Extramaduna in the 1960s. Each of the members of the poor family is spotlighted for a part of the film.

results.title: The City: cars or people?
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
A study of an old but dangerously growing problem - how to make the city accessible without allowing transport to make it congested and uninhabitable, as the private car now threatens.

results.title: The City: heaven and hell
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
An outline of the opposed natures - creative and destructive - of the city in history, the elements that created the first cities about 5000 years ago, and the forces that now threaten to destroy them.

results.title: The Hobbit
results.creator_credit: Arthur Rankin Jnr, Jules Bass and Rankin-Bass Productions
results.brief_description: Bilbo Baggins journeys into the Middle Earth, a place inhabited by Elves, dwarves, Wizards, Goblins, Dragons and Hobbits in an effort to reclaim the gold of the Dwarf King. It is an adventurous journey and a battle between the forces of Evil. This animated feature based on J.R.R. Tolkien’s timeless classic features the voices of John Huston (Gandalf the Grey), Otto Preminger (Elvenking) and Orson Bean (Bilbo Baggins).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Rankin Jnr, Jules Bass and Rankin-Bass Productions
results.description:
Bilbo Baggins journeys into Middle Earth, a place inhabited by elves, dwarves, wizards, goblins, dragons and hobbits, in an effort to reclaim the gold of the Dwarf King.

It’s an adventurous journey that features a battle between the forces of good and evil. This animated feature based on JRR Tolkien’s timeless classic features the voices of John Huston (Gandalf the Grey), Otto Preminger (Elvenking) and Orson Bean (Bilbo Baggins).

results.title: The Highway of steel
results.creator_credit: Ralph McCromick, Harold Goodwin and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Emphasises the part played by the British Railways in the production of steel in Great Britain. How iron ore, coke for smelting, and limestone for steel manufacture are transported to the steel works. Follows the production of steel from pig iron to the finished product.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ralph McCromick, Harold Goodwin and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.description: Emphasises the part played by the British Railways in the production of steel in Great Britain. How iron ore, coke for smelting, and limestone for steel manufacture are transported to the steel works. Follows the production of steel from pig iron to the finished product.
